comment: Mastering the HW problems is crucial. Reading is also important. You get out what you put it. Read and do HW BEFORE lecture! Lectures are mostly higher level theory vs. quantitative examples. But, he's happy to work problems if you ask him. Don't expect to sit in lecture and have information spoon fed to you. He's very knowledgeable about physics.

Professor explains the theory well. Make sure you read and do homework. Test are 10 questions with partial credit. 1st 2 test are hard. Lab is easy A. DO ALL THE HOMEWORK and understand the formulas he tells you to study. DO NOT BE LAZY PHYSICS II IS HARD ANYWHERE. Professor is fair and follows his rules 100%.

The class is hard itself. Professor makes it harder. Do the homework, ALL OF IT. Rambles on a lot. The first two tests are the hardest, EVER. He gives cheat sheets during tests that are useful. Final was extremely difficult.  No curves, no drops, no quizzes, no homework graded. Only tests are graded. Avoid if possible, especially in the summer.

This is the worst professor I've had so far. We formed a study group in our class because teacher did not teach as ANYTHING at all. If we would do homework and then listen to what he explains in class, we would always get very confused. Always talks about random things instead of focusing on the subject. I really did not like this class.

I took him for 1211 and 1112 and have no complaints, Very Fair! Grading scale is great 63 is a C. UNDERSTAND THE HOMEWORK COMPLETELY and their should be no surprises on the exams. Although he does think very highly of his 1212 class and repetitively told us how it is the "hardest class on campus" Would take him again.
This professor is so HARD, DO NOT TAKE HIME PLS. his tests are so hard, I wish he would make test easier. I Ended up getting C in class, but i would not take him again, because he is so hard.

Class (and the final) are EASIER than others make it sound. Make sure you understand HW 100% and ask him to do all problems you don't. Tests are short and no drops so be very careful with your math errors. Labs are guaranteed 95%, but you'll have to go to class and understand the HW to pull an A. Easy B otherwise.

Does he know his stuff? Yes. Will you despise physics after taking his class? Yes.  I actually was looking forward to this class, I ended up learning very little and hating physics after this course.  As others have stated he does make valid points during lecture, it just happens to be a rare occasion that they are valid to the class.

He knows physics but he is a mediocre professor. Goes off on a tangent EVERY class. Tests are difficult but final is IMPOSSIBLE. He made the entire class feel stupid because we were assigned a particular book. Make sure your questions aren't obvious to HIM or he will make YOU feel stupid. Proud to make a C.

There is no question this professor knows physics, teaching on the other hand is not his strong point. He is a nice guy, but his lecture notes are mostly useless. He gives so much detail it is hard to pick out the important stuff. If you like things direct and to the point this class will drive you insane like it has me.

He's a good professor. Tests are not exactly like the homework, but if you do the homework you should at least make a B. He may get off topic sometimes, but keep in mind how many classes and labs this guy teaches. If you can find him outside of class he's very helpful. His formulas sheets are really helpful too.

I thought that after I had him for 2211 that I would do ok in his 2212.  I guessed that I would be used to his bogus and/or absent teaching techniques.  Not the case.  Worthless lectures.  The only classes worth attending are the ones where he works problems.  Apt to be a jerk(even if its unintentional) to people who ask questions

Ok, He is not that bad but gezzz does he ramble about things a student does not care about (department politics, history, personal problems).  This makes the class extremely dry and unhelpful. The exams however are not that bad and if you read and do homework a B is cake (78.5 is a B). I however, will not take him ever again.

Dr. Whitenton Knows the material very well and can explain in it a way that is easy to understand. The tests are generally close to the homework, but knowing how to work with the equations he gives you is also vital to doing well in here.

This man is a teacher. I am sure my grade may not show that, but that is my problem. I learned Physics. His teaching methods may be unorthodox, but in my opion that is what makes him a great TEACHER. Thank You Sir..
I WOULD NOT TAKE HIM....do not take him, his grading system is very bad. i would  not him. he used to be easy...

I have taken him for 2211, and 1112--Before the so-called "EASY" comments and after.  His class is NOT easy. He teaches the material very well. If you DO YOUR HOMEWORK CORRECTLY, TAKE NOTES and ASK QUESTIONS you will be fine.Physics is not a spectator sport. Prepare for class and Work hard --if you are not prepared you will fail.

I found this class difficult. I did all the homeworks but did poorly on the exams. He certainly knows his subject well, but the rambling and off-subject tangents were very distracting-they affected my attendance. He is clearly upset by many of the comments on this website;he mentioned it nearly every class.  I think he has made the tests harder.
he is kind of hard

Contrary to previous comments, he is a good professor. He tends to go off on tangents sometimes (which affected my attendance) and can explain something with too much detail (which meant lost time for learning other things). Though, if you do the homework and actually try and understand the concept, then you will get a good grade.

I think he is a great professor. He definately understands the material, and if you listen in class, you will understand it too. He does get a little rambling sometimes (and because he taught so well, I thought this was just humorous). Attendance is MANDATORY. I worked hard for him, I can tell you from experience it's not impossible to get an A.

he has changed.....like evolved from the professor that some said he was in prior comments. he is sooo mad about someone calling his class easy on his rate my professor profile. his class is still easy to pass, but it is impossible to get an a. his grading system is way messed up and his formula sheet is a joke. again easy to pass!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

He knows his stuff, and will teach you when he isn't talking about his PHYS 1111 class, or anything else for that matter. Tests are like the homework, so do it. The formula sheet is also very helpful if you study with it. Attendance wasn't mandatory, but he said he would assign some serious derivations on the tests if nobody showed up.

When he isn't rambling about typos he made in his 5 page sylabus he is rambling about his rating on ratemyproffesor.com, ensuring you that he is not as easy as his reviews indicate and he will fail you. I did not learn much in this class nor would I recommend it, but he is the least of the evils for pysics at this school.

I sat in a recitation last week in which he did one problem in an hour.  The other 50 minutes were spent by him yammering about his 1985 casio calculator and classes he taught in the 90's compared to today.  This was a one sided engagement, no one in the class asked about any of this.  One instance of his tendency to skew off on irrelavent tangents

I had him for Physics II, and he was great.  He mad very clear points in class.  He went over homework problems in class every class.  His tests were easy and just like the homework.  If you understand the homework, you'll do fine.  His labs are easy; he just gives you a check for lab grades.  I highly recommend him.

Wow! He is the easiest Physics professor one can take.  Tests come straight out of the homework, but you do have to read the book to fully understand the concepts .  It is essential to get a good understanding of ALL the concepts because most of the final does come from homework problems!!  To suceed in this class, READ THE BOOK!!!!

As long as you do the homework, you'll pass the tests with A's. He doesn't like to lecture from the book, so you only need the book for homework. He doesn't like to do labs, so they are VERY easy. He does give a formula sheet, but you need to do homework to understand them. I suggest getting an answer book as well. Goes over problems in class.

Not very good. Would skip whole chapters and whole ideas... like momentum. So, if you just want to get throught the class and don't care about actually learning anything... go for it. but if you actually need to know the stuff, just avoid him.

This is 2nd time taking 2211 under Whitenton.  He's a very nice man, but he does not know how to lecture.  His tests are based on homework problems that he assigns, but he doesn't work the problems unless he's asked.  It takes him a whole period to work 1 problem.  The key to passing is DOING ALL HMWK problems, but there are a lot!!

He knows what he is talking bout in class, i never thought someone could make physics so understandable. If you know what you want, you'll make an A in his class. wish we had more physics professors like him around the world. He is good.

This guys knows the stuff inside out, very nice guy. He gives you answers to homework, up to you to do it. If you can do the homework you can A's the tests. He does not collect homework, but thats your practice. You are expected to do problems and study, just showing up is not going to do it. A Little effort w/ this guy and you got an A
A little boring, but good at explaining. Tests and grading were fair. Labs were helpful in understanding material.
he goes off topic every class.  tests reflect h.w.  classes are so boring, doesn't make phys really intrst.  but i heard he is better than thakston.  take tambe, he is the best phys teacher in SPSU
Pretty good teacher. He does talk a lot about nothing some times, but he made me like physics more and more. I have actually considered a minor in physics. Fairly easy test. I would take him again.
Grades very easy on labs.
